TITLE: These mid-year tax strategies can trim next year’s bill from the IRS and reduce 'unwelcome surprises'
SUMMARY: Whether you typically receive a tax refund or a bill, there’s still plenty of time to improve next year’s filing, experts say. Here are four moves to consider.

TITLE: New Republican plan calls for renewing monthly child tax credit payments — but there are 'significant' trade-offs, one report finds
SUMMARY: A new Republican proposal calls for sending parents monthly child tax credit checks of up to $350 per child. But not all families may benefit, a report finds.

TITLE: Rate resets on 9.62% interest, taxes, inherited assets: Experts weigh in on 3 tricky questions about Series I bonds
SUMMARY: The demand for Series I bonds has skyrocketed as investors seek refuge from soaring inflation and stock market volatility. Here's what to know before buying.

TITLE: Amazon Prime Day is coming up: Here's why deal experts say you might want to skip it this year
SUMMARY: Just because something is discounted on Prime Day doesn't mean it's the best deal you'll see anywhere, or even all year.

TITLE: Economic worries further older Americans' pandemic-era plans to delay retirement, survey finds
SUMMARY: Last July, about a third of 11,000 older Americans surveyed said they expected to delay retirement. Earlier this year, 59% of them said that they expected to.

TITLE: Number of Americans involuntarily working part-time falls by 707,000 to 3.6 million, lowest level in 21 years
SUMMARY: The number of part-time workers who would have preferred a full-time job declined to 3.6 million people in June, the lowest number since August 2001.

TITLE: Here's a tax-smart charitable giving strategy using money from your IRA
SUMMARY: There's no shortage of ways to give to charity. And certain retirees may get a special tax break by donating from their individual retirement account.

TITLE: Protecting Social Security benefits from rising inflation is high on voters' wish lists, survey finds
SUMMARY: Social Security reform is one issue on Congress' to-do list. Voters want their benefits protected from inflation amid record high prices, a new survey finds.

TITLE: Do you have recession anxiety? Here are 5 ways to cope, according to a psychotherapist and a financial psychologist
SUMMARY: Even just the possibility of a recession is enough to fuel anxiety. Here are 5 expert recommendations for weathering the stress.

TITLE: What to know if your employer changes 401(k) providers. 'Mistakes happen' in transfers, advisor warns
SUMMARY: Companies change retirement plan administrators every once in a while. There are some simple steps workers should take to make sure the switch was smooth.

TITLE: How are rising costs impacting your household? Here's how to calculate your personal inflation rate
SUMMARY: Costs are rising across the U.S. economy. But how is inflation impacting your household? Here are a few calculations to find out.

TITLE: Fake charities can be almost impossible to spot. Here's how to make sure your donations get to the right place
SUMMARY: In times of crisis, donations can go a long way to helping people in need. But scammers will try to capitalize on your compassion.

TITLE: As states and cities raise minimum wage rates, some experts say a higher federal rate is long overdue
SUMMARY: The federal minimum wage has been $7.25 per hour since 2009. As some states and cities are moving toward higher rates, experts back a national increase.

TITLE: Rising mortgage rates are hitting Americans' wallets. Here's how to adjust your housing budget
SUMMARY: Higher mortgage rates means a higher monthly bill for homebuyers.

TITLE: Here’s how much cash you need to ride out a recession at different life stages, according to financial advisors
SUMMARY: With the threat of a recession looming, financial experts share how to prepare, including how much cash to set aside.

TITLE: The job market is still 'red hot' despite recession fears, as the Great Resignation continues
SUMMARY: Employer demand for workers remains extremely high and layoffs are near historical lows. How long it will remain a job seeker's market is an open question.

TITLE: Biden administration plans to make sweeping changes to 'broken' student loan system
SUMMARY: The Biden administration announced Wednesday it was moving to make sweeping changes to the federal student loan system.

TITLE: Washington leaders agree Social Security needs to be fixed — but proposed tax increases are a key sticking point
SUMMARY: Congressional leaders can agree on one thing — Social Security needs to be fixed before the program's funds are unable to pay full benefits in 2035.

TITLE: Here's how investors can avoid violating ‘wash sale rules’ when realizing tax losses
SUMMARY: If you're eager to take advantage of tax-loss harvesting in a down market, you need to know how the "wash sale rule" works, according to experts.

TITLE: Luxury car buyers shell out more than ever with 'car payments that look more like mortgage payments'
SUMMARY: The share of new car buyers with a monthly payment of more than $1,000 jumped to a record high, according to Edmunds.

TITLE: Supreme Court limited EPA’s ability to regulate greenhouse gas emissions. Here’s how investors can buy a carbon-conscious fund
SUMMARY: The high court limited the EPA's authority to regulate planet-warming emissions. Investors who want to take a climate stand can try a carbon-conscious fund.

TITLE: These 5 metros have the most million-dollar homes: If you're selling, here's what to know about the tax consequences
SUMMARY: A report finds million-dollar homes are most likely to be in metropolitan areas on the coasts. Here's what to know when selling a high-value property.

TITLE: 74% of consumers are concerned about a recession: 5 steps you can take now to prepare
SUMMARY: Recessions are part of the normal economic cycle. Whether one is in the near future or further out, here's what you can do to get ready.

TITLE: Teen workers in a hot summer job market can use the 'greatest money-making asset' to their advantage, says CPA
SUMMARY: For teenagers looking for summer work, opportunities — and wages — are looking up. Here's how they can make the most of their first paycheck.

TITLE: Some experts say a recession is coming. Here's how to prepare your portfolio
SUMMARY: Some 68% of chief financial officers expect a recession to occur during the first half of 2023, according to a CNBC survey. Here's how to prep your portfolio.

TITLE: Student loan borrowers may regret not taking these 3 steps before payments restart
SUMMARY: The student loan payment pause could be extended again, but borrowers shouldn't count on it. Instead, experts recommend they take these steps.

TITLE: Settled medical debt is now dropping off credit reports — here's how to check your record and make sure it's right
SUMMARY: As of Friday, your credit report should no longer include paid-off medical debt. You may want to confirm your report is right, consumer advocates say.

TITLE: The S&P 500 just had its worst first half in more than 50 years, which 'stressed' this classic investment strategy
SUMMARY: A classic 60/40 asset allocation strategy for investors has been stressed this year as both stocks and bonds plunge. But it's still solid, advisors say.

TITLE: Social Security Administration addressing 'deficiencies' in handling mail during pandemic, says government watchdog report
SUMMARY: A new report details the results of an investigation into deficiencies in the Social Security Administration's handling of mail during the Covid-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Op-ed: This 'unfamiliar' type of bond fund may offer opportunities for fixed-income investors
SUMMARY: After a recent sell-off, closed-end municipal bond funds now present opportunities for both income and potential share-price growth.
